Data: MyAnimeList.net      Hide AdsLoginSign Up  AllAnimeMangaCharactersPeopleCompaniesManga StoreNewsFeatured ArticlesForumClubsUsers               View all results for ${ keyword }  Anime  Anime Search Top Anime Seasonal Anime Videos Reviews Recommendations 2022 ChallengeFantasy Anime League  Manga  Manga Search Top Manga Manga Store Reviews Recommendations 2022 Challenge   Community  Interest Stacks Forums Clubs Blogs Users   Industry  News Featured Articles People Characters Companies MAL×Japan   Watch  Episode Videos Anime Trailers  Read  Manga Store   Help  About Support Advertising FAQ Report StaffMAL Supporter     Reviews                Top                             >                 Anime                             >                 Arte                             >                 Reviews                             >                 The_Namer's Review                               Apr 9, 2022                    12 of 12 episodes seen                 Overall Rating:         8          Arte  (Anime) add            (All reviews)                         The_Namer (All reviews)   1                people found this review helpful                           more pics      Overall 8   Story 8   Animation 6   Sound 6   Character 7   Enjoyment 8                              Yet another show that has been misattributed as Slice of Life on MAL. At this point I'm convinced that label gets slapped on any anime that doesn't revolve around fight scenes. Be in no doubt though, while Arte's tale of a young noble girl who runs away from home to become an artist doesn't involve overt fisticuffs, the story has more in common with sports anime like Hajime no Ippo than it does with SoL shows like Yurucamp. The trademark SoL genre traits of minimal conflict and loose plot structure are nowhere to be found here.  Set in renaissance Florence, Arte's quest to become a professional artist is met with constant roadblocks due to the overwhelming sexism of the time. Armed with borderline genki girl tenacity, Arte bull rushes her way through each obstacle, often becoming literally bruised and bloodied in the process. This results in a classic battle anime fight-then-bond cycle where Arte's unwavering drive and spirit turns today's opponents into tomorrow's friends. The first episode even follows the classic sports anime trope of the grumpy master setting the cocky young whelp a seemingly impossible test because he thinks she's underestimated the hard work and guts required.  If the show does have one problem, it's in setting the bar too low for itself at times. By setting the story in a time and place even more sexist than modern Japan, we end up with a cast of characters who spend the first several episodes being baffled that a girl would attempt to do anything other than bat her eyelashes at potential suitors, which can get repetitive. While this does present strong conflicts for Arte to overcome, the story can come across as being a little too pleased with itself for having her accomplish... well, basically anything. It's not too much of a blemish on an otherwise engaging story, however, especially when this is one where the protagonist views even falling in love as just another obstacle getting in the way of her career. Apr 9, 2022                    12 of 12 episodes seen                 Overall Rating:         8          Arte  (Anime) add            (All reviews)                         The_Namer (All reviews)   1                people found this review helpful                           more pics      Overall 8   Story 8   Animation 6   Sound 6   Character 7   Enjoyment 8                              Yet another show that has been misattributed as Slice of Life on MAL. At this point I'm convinced that label gets slapped on any anime that doesn't revolve around fight scenes. Be in no doubt though, while Arte's tale of a young noble girl who runs away from home to become an artist doesn't involve overt fisticuffs, the story has more in common with sports anime like Hajime no Ippo than it does with SoL shows like Yurucamp. The trademark SoL genre traits of minimal conflict and loose plot structure are nowhere to be found here.  Set in renaissance Florence, Arte's quest to become a professional artist is met with constant roadblocks due to the overwhelming sexism of the time. Armed with borderline genki girl tenacity, Arte bull rushes her way through each obstacle, often becoming literally bruised and bloodied in the process. This results in a classic battle anime fight-then-bond cycle where Arte's unwavering drive and spirit turns today's opponents into tomorrow's friends. The first episode even follows the classic sports anime trope of the grumpy master setting the cocky young whelp a seemingly impossible test because he thinks she's underestimated the hard work and guts required.  If the show does have one problem, it's in setting the bar too low for itself at times. By setting the story in a time and place even more sexist than modern Japan, we end up with a cast of characters who spend the first several episodes being baffled that a girl would attempt to do anything other than bat her eyelashes at potential suitors, which can get repetitive. While this does present strong conflicts for Arte to overcome, the story can come across as being a little too pleased with itself for having her accomplish... well, basically anything. It's not too much of a blemish on an otherwise engaging story, however, especially when this is one where the protagonist views even falling in love as just another obstacle getting in the way of her career.              Helpful       report

https://myanimelist.net/reviews.php?id=4.Title: Akebi-chan no Sailor-fuku - cat_coffee's Review - MyAnimeList.net
Data: MyAnimeList.net      Hide AdsLoginSign Up  AllAnimeMangaCharactersPeopleCompaniesManga StoreNewsFeatured ArticlesForumClubsUsers               View all results for ${ keyword }  Anime  Anime Search Top Anime Seasonal Anime Videos Reviews Recommendations 2022 ChallengeFantasy Anime League  Manga  Manga Search Top Manga Manga Store Reviews Recommendations 2022 Challenge   Community  Interest Stacks Forums Clubs Blogs Users   Industry  News Featured Articles People Characters Companies MAL×Japan   Watch  Episode Videos Anime Trailers  Read  Manga Store   Help  About Support Advertising FAQ Report StaffMAL Supporter     Reviews                Top                             >                 Anime                             >                 Akebi-chan no Sailor-fuku                             >                 Reviews                             >                 cat_coffee's Review                               Apr 9, 2022                    12 of 12 episodes seen                 Overall Rating:         10          Akebi-chan no Sailor-fuku  (Anime) add            (All reviews)                         cat_coffee (All reviews)   1                people found this review helpful                           more pics      Overall 10   Story 10   Animation 10   Sound 10   Character 10   Enjoyment 10                              Akebi's Sailor Uniform is a great dream while it lasts. And then I realized it's a dream I'll never get back.   Akebi is a Mary Sue because that's what a teenage girl would write in her fantasy. You'll see a lot of girls with their own problems. Too short, too tall, too inexperienced, too fat, a projection of all the worries a middle-school girl would have. All one-note characters, but after learning notes, you proceed to understand chords. It's girl of the week until everything is tied together.  Hebimori's episode does a great job on the music. You will be wondering why a piano is playing instead of guitar music. It's interesting because the story goes from using Akebi as a lens to explore the school to needing Akebi to keep everything together.   The fanservice is certainly artistic but I think of it as something to live with. As we grow into adults, we learn to restrain ourselves. Yet as a middle-schooler, Akebi and friends don't quite have that sense of self-control. Thus, the show focuses on "socially-acceptable" things to stare at like armpits and feet and turns it up to eleven.  Animation is great, art is great, the OP starts off strong and energetic. The ED is tragically fuzzy and nostalgic and the father can barely take any time off to see his family. I don't think I've cried to an anime as much as this one.              Helpful       report

https://myanimelist.net/reviews.php?id=4.Title: Kenja no Deshi wo Nanoru Kenja - NeisanAnimeList's Review - MyAnimeList.net
Data: MyAnimeList.net      Hide AdsLoginSign Up  AllAnimeMangaCharactersPeopleCompaniesManga StoreNewsFeatured ArticlesForumClubsUsers               View all results for ${ keyword }  Anime  Anime Search Top Anime Seasonal Anime Videos Reviews Recommendations 2022 ChallengeFantasy Anime League  Manga  Manga Search Top Manga Manga Store Reviews Recommendations 2022 Challenge   Community  Interest Stacks Forums Clubs Blogs Users   Industry  News Featured Articles People Characters Companies MAL×Japan   Watch  Episode Videos Anime Trailers  Read  Manga Store   Help  About Support Advertising FAQ Report StaffMAL Supporter     Reviews                Top                             >                 Anime                             >                 Kenja no Deshi wo Nanoru Kenja                             >                 Reviews                             >                 NeisanAnimeList's Review                               Apr 9, 2022                    12 of 12 episodes seen                 Overall Rating:         6          Kenja no Deshi wo Nanoru Kenja  (Anime) add            (All reviews)                         NeisanAnimeList (All reviews)   0                people found this review helpful                           more pics      Overall 6   Story 7   Animation 7   Sound 5   Character 7   Enjoyment 6                              TLDR: The plot on paper is good the execution is shoddy. Still enjoyable to me as I am easy to please but don't expect any uber attention grabbing moments. Lacks seriousness, but very light-hearted if that's what you like.  I think the whole premise of the story is interesting and intriguing on paper. You suddenly wake up in the video game you love not knowing when or why it happened, yet 30 years have passed and another friend of yours who plays was waiting for you the whole time. On top of which the other 7 players that you used to play with are missing which you have to find is another interesting storyline as well.   These two separate storylines could be cohesive as finding more players not just the seven could lead to info about what happened and how everyone started living and breathing the game in a literal sense came about, but the episodes severely lack this. Even episodes that seem to pertain to the main plot points lack anything substantial in progressing the story.  Overall, it is an anime that seems like the plot is really good and may have some interesting dark or serious moments but the anime's execution is very lighthearted and feels empty. As though, I was watching filler episodes.              Helpful       report

Still enjoyable to me as I am easy to please but don't expect any uber attention grabbing moments. Lacks seriousness, but very light-hearted if that's what you like.  I think the whole premise of the story is interesting and intriguing on paper. You suddenly wake up in the video game you love not knowing when or why it happened, yet 30 years have passed and another friend of yours who plays was waiting for you the whole time. On top of which the other 7 players that you used to play with are missing which you have to find is another interesting storyline as well.   These two separate storylines could be cohesive as finding more players not just the seven could lead to info about what happened and how everyone started living and breathing the game in a literal sense came about, but the episodes severely lack this. Even episodes that seem to pertain to the main plot points lack anything substantial in progressing the story.  Overall, it is an anime that seems like the plot is really good and may have some interesting dark or serious moments but the anime's execution is very lighthearted and feels empty.
